abstract.text: A manager that applies and removes hotspot configurations of Wi-Fi networks.

inlineContent.text: When your app creates a new hotspot configuration using

and applies it to a Wi-Fi network or attempts to update a previously configured network, the device prompts the user for approval. Without explicit user consent, your app canâ€™t make configuration changes.
to delete a configuration that it has added, but not a configuration added by another app or user. The user can also delete configured networks using Settings > Wi-Fi.
When your app is uninstalled, iOS removes the configurations of all networks your app has configured, including their keychain entries.

abstract.text: A Boolean value indicating whether your app can use the hotspot manager to configure Wi-Fi networks.
Customize and extend core networking features.
Configuration settings for a Wi-Fi network.
Error values returned by hotspot configuration manager methods.
The domain string for errors involving hotspot configuration.
A manager that applies and removes hotspot configurations of Wi-Fi networks.
Adds or updates a Wi-Fi network configuration after prompting the user for permission, and then attempts to join the network under certain conditions.
Submits a completion handler the configuration manager calls to send your app
the names of the SSIDs or Wi-Fi hotspot domains in the configuration.
Removes a Wi-Fi hotspot configuration, identified by a Hotspot 2.0 domain name, that your app previously added.
Removes a Wi-Fi configuration, identified by an SSID, that your app previously added.
Instantiates
as a singleton, so it can be shared.
Extensible Authentication Protocol settings for configuring WPA and WPA2 enterprise Wi-Fi networks.
Settings for configuring Hotspot 2.0 Wi-Fi networks.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
